attributes.action: ensure that there is a proper separation of powers within the UK by de-linking the Executive and Legislative arms of Government, and making the position of Prime Minister directly elected in time for the next General Election.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Good democracy demands a separation of powers between the Executive, the Legislature and the Judiciary.

Making the PM directly elected will assist in achieving this aim.

It will also make what we are voting for at a General Election clearer in voters' minds: at present we vote for a mixture of MP, PM, party, policies and policy (although we are always told that we "do not have single issue elections" politicians are always quick to justify any policy by saying that we voted for "it"!).

The PM could still be made accountable to Parliament.  PMQs could still be retained.

Best of all it would encourage MPs to be more independent of their Party when voting for/against policy.
